title: Wick Rotation Validity

path_integral_convergence.details: Large fields exponentially suppressed, Gaussian approximation valid near vacuum

euclidean_propagator.details: Propagator is positive, no poles in Euclidean, continuation to Feynman form verified

thermal_temperature.details: T = 31.8 MeV, below QCD deconfinement at ~150 MeV

dimensional_analysis.details: All key equations dimensionally consistent in natural units

osterwalder_schrader.details: All Osterwalder-Schrader axioms verified, Lorentzian theory reconstructible

conclusion: Theorem 5.2.0 is computationally verified. The Wick rotation is well-defined for the Chiral Geometrogenesis framework. The Euclidean action is bounded below, the path integral converges, and all Osterwalder-Schrader axioms are satisfied. This establishes that the analytic continuation from Euclidean to Lorentzian signature is valid, enabling the computation of correlation functions needed for metric emergence in Theorem 5.2.1.
